meanings.sent1: The ancient city had a strong vallation to protect it from invaders.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers patrolled along the vallation to ensure the safety of the town.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played hide-and-seek around the vallation, pretending it was a magical barrier.
meanings.sent4: The vallation stood tall like a guardian, shielding the city from any harm.
meanings.sent5: The vallation loomed imposingly, a symbol of strength and security.

meanings.definition: The act of fortifying with a wall or rampart.
meanings.sent1: The vallation of the castle was a massive project that took months to complete.
meanings.sent2: After the vallation was finished, the fortress was nearly impregnable.
meanings.sent3: The villagers cheered as they watched the builders work on the vallation, knowing it would keep them safe.
meanings.sent4: The vallation rose like a shield, protecting the town from any external threats.
meanings.sent5: The vallation was a testament to the determination of the people to defend their home.
